title: Hola Amigos, AMA!

replies.body:
If the average of 5 consecutive odd numbers is 30, what is the beginning and end number?
Convert pie to fraction form (22/7) and add that to the percentage of highly successful genetic engineering scientists. What's the answer?
Did you know a microwave uses radioactive waves to heat up your food?

replies.body:
Where do you live? Mexico
What is your real name? Luis
Favourite food? Enchiladas
Favourite drink? Delaware Punch
 Favourite animal? Penguin
Favourite fruit? Mango
Favourite colour? Green
Favourite Avicus map? CubeMC (so ez xd)
 Favourite OCN Map? Dj and Desert Santuary
 Avicus or OCN? Both :(
How did you find this server? A friend spam me on skype, but i only joine, i started to play cause nova said me in skype "join etcr?" and i say: "it maybe be fun"
How did you find OCN? A school friend invited me to play
Opinions on me? Really nice guy, nice pvp, one of the first english language players that i talked

replies.body: Why did you leave EC?
replies.body_tagged: Why did you leave EC?

replies.body: Honestly, i got bored, they are never connected, i had to leader cause nova its banned and he is always on the beach, people like bloodoh always shouting or saying stupid things, maybe i dont want they for a team in this moment, maybe i will apply for try out later, but, i dont think so, maybe they are not the team that i want, but theyre my friends, i can spend a lot of time talking with them, and i love (nogay) all members on ETCR :)

replies.body: What does Gringo mean?
replies.body_tagged: What does Gringo mean?

replies.body: What does Beaner mean?
replies.body_tagged: What does Beaner mean?

replies.body: Idk what does it mean?
replies.body_tagged: Idk what does it mean?

replies.body:
Beaner -> Bean -> Frijol -> Er -> Verb -> "¿Frijolero?"

Gringo:
In 1845 - 1847 there were a war in Alamo, Texas, Mexico were fighting v USA, and the people from USA were using green uniform, the mexican people were shouting "GREEN GO", and, if u say that in spanish it sounds like "GRINGO"... thats why :)
Its only a history, maybe its not true, since i borned i have been hearing the word "gringo", and like 4 years ago i asked to my parents and they told me that, also i searched it on google, and its the same history
replies.body_tagged:
Beaner -> Bean -> Frijol -> Er -> Verb -> "¿Frijolero?"

Gringo:
In 1845 - 1847 there were a war in Alamo, Texas, Mexico were fighting v USA, and the people from USA were using green uniform, the mexican people were shouting "GREEN GO", and, if u say that in spanish it sounds like "GRINGO"... thats why :)
Its only a history, maybe its not true, since i borned i have been hearing the word "gringo", and like 4 years ago i asked to my parents and they told me that, also i searched it on google, and its the same history

replies.body:
Another story (i belive more in this one)

In the same battle, the USA army were divided in groups
Blue, red, green, yellow... etc
and in the battlecamp the leader from the green army were shouting: "GREEN GOO!"
and it sounds like "gringo", remember that in that time a lot of people didnt talk english (maybe a bit), so they heared "gringo" and they thought that was their name
